caseTitle: Imran Ahmad Khan Niazi v. Federation of Pakistan through Secretary, Law and Justice Division, Islamabad and another
authorJudge: Mr. Justice Syed Mansoor Ali Shah
tagline: DISSENT IN NAB AMENDMENTS CASE - (i) Elected holders of public offices are "public servants" and are thus triable for offences under the Prevention of Corruption Act;(ii) Challenged amendments have merely changed forums for investigation and trial of certain offences, which falls within the policy domain of legislature (Parliament); (iii) Challenged amendments (law made by the Parliament) do not take away or abridge any of the fundamental rights.
